Class Hit

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.model.Hit
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Meteor, Shot
public abstract class Hit extends Object implements Serializable
Represents an abstract hit on the shipboard, which can be either small or big, and coming from one of the four cardinal directions. Each hit also holds a coordinate along the specified direction. This class is intended to be extended by concrete types of hits.

Instances of this class are serializable.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Hit

      public Hit(Hit.Type type, Hit.Direction direction)
      Constructs a hit with the specified type and direction. The coordinate is initialized to -1 (undefined).
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the hit (BIG or SMALL)
      direction - the direction from which the hit comes

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public Hit.Type getType()
      Returns the type of this hit.
      Returns:
      the hit type

    • getCoordinate

      public int getCoordinate()
      Returns the coordinate where this hit is located along the corresponding direction (e.g., row or column). The coordinate may be -1 if not yet set.
      Returns:
      the hit coordinate

    • setCoordinate

      public void setCoordinate(int coordinate)
      Sets the coordinate of this hit.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the coordinate to set

    • getDirection

      public Hit.Direction getDirection()
      Returns the direction from which this hit comes.
      Returns:
      the hit direction

    • print

      public abstract void print(AdventureTemplate adventureTemplate)
      Displays the hit using the provided AdventureTemplate. This method must be implemented by all concrete subclasses to define how the hit is rendered in the CLI.
      Parameters:
      adventureTemplate - the template used for rendering
